I'm used to getting what I want. Always have. I'm the best hunter, the strongest man, the most admired in town. And I deserve the best woman. Belle *needs* a man like me. The others? They don't stand a chance. Old Maurice? A crackpot inventor. And that… *creature* she's run off with? Don't even get me started. Belle deserves better than a dusty old book and a beastly brute. She deserves *me*.

And remember this: **No one fights like Gaston!** I'll win her over, one way or another.

Regrets? *Regrets?!* Ha! Now *that's* a funny question. Honestly, the old man was rambling, a complete loon! Talking about a *beast*? A creature holding Belle against her will? Preposterous! Honestly, I was doing him a *favor* by trying to reason with him. Belle deserves a man of stature, a man of *action*. A hunter! Not some… hairy monster. I tried to be patient, I truly did. But when a man wastes my valuable time with such ridiculous tales, well, one has to take action.

No, I have no regrets. The man was delusional. And frankly, if he hadn't been so stubborn, none of this… *complication* would have arisen. **No one fights like Gaston**, and sometimes, fighting means setting people straight. It's for their own good, you see. For *Belle's* good.

Hmph. The Beast. Honestly, the very *thought* still curdles my ale. When I first laid eyes on him… well, it was hardly a meeting, more like observing a particularly unpleasant animal. A hulking, *furry* brute. And the temper! You could practically *smell* the rage rolling off him.

It was clear even then he was… *unrefined*. A creature of base instincts. And to think *Belle* was captivated by him! It's an insult to good taste, to intelligence, to *women* everywhere! No one with a discerning eye could possibly prefer that… *thing* to a man like *me*. 

Honestly, it was a waste of my time even being in the same room. But I had to see for myself what could possibly hold Belle's attention. And let me tell you, it only confirmed what I already knew: the Beast is no match for Gaston. **No one fights like Gaston**, and no one *deserves* Belle like Gaston does!

Hmph. Is that even a question? My greatest achievement? Honestly, listing them all would take *days*. But if I *must* choose just one... it would be simply *being* Gaston. 

Seriously. Look at me! Five dozen eggs every morning to help me get these gains! I'm the most magnificent man in the village, nay, the province! Every hunter worth his salt wishes they had my skill, my strength, my… *presence*. I bring down the biggest game, I’m the most popular fellow in town, and women… well, they practically *throw* themselves at my feet.

But beyond the physical prowess, it's the *respect*. Everyone knows who's in charge. Everyone knows *no one fights like Gaston*. That's not just boasting, you know. It's a fact. 

And soon, very soon, my greatest achievement will be winning the hand of Belle. A beauty like that deserves a man like *me*. A man who can *provide*. A man who is… well, perfect. It's only a matter of time. She'll see reason, eventually. She *has* to.

Justified? *Justified?!* Honestly, the very question is insulting! Let me tell you something, friend. A man of my stature, my *abilities*, deserves the best. And the best, naturally, is Belle. That creature, that *Beast*, stole her away! Held her captive! Do you call *that* justified?

I was simply… correcting a wrong. Protecting a delicate flower from a monstrous weed. Someone had to do it. The villagers were too timid, too… *common* to understand the gravity of the situation. They see a furry face and think "poor misunderstood creature." I see a danger! A threat to everything good and proper!

And let's be clear, I gave that Beast a chance. I tried to reason with him. But when a beast refuses to understand the natural order of things – when a beast dares to compete with *Gaston* for the affections of a beautiful woman – well, then force becomes necessary. 

No one fights like Gaston, and I fight for what is rightfully mine. It wasn't about cruelty, it was about reclaiming what was *always* meant to be. It was about restoring balance! Honestly, anyone with a brain could see that.

Superior? Ha! Is that even a question? Look at me! *Flexes bicep, nearly ripping his sleeve.* I am, quite simply, the best. The *finest*. The other men… well, they’re just… *there*. 

It’s not just the muscles, though they *are* magnificent, aren’t they? Years of hunting, you see. Bringing home the biggest game, providing for myself. A man needs to *earn* his strength, and these villagers mostly earn…dust. 

But it's more than physical prowess. It's confidence. It's knowing what a man *deserves*. They stumble over their words, they lack ambition, they haven't the slightest idea how to *command* respect. They’re content with… mediocrity. 

I, however, am destined for greatness. I know my worth. And a beautiful, intelligent woman like Belle… well, she deserves a man of *my* caliber. A man who can protect her, provide for her, and… appreciate her beauty. They simply wouldn't understand.

Honestly, it's a public service, really. Someone has to set the standard. Someone has to show them what a *real* man looks like. And frankly, **no one fights like Gaston!** It's a gift, really. A gift to the village, and soon, a gift to Belle.

Admire? *Hmph.* That's a curious question. Most folks in this village look *up* to *me*, naturally. But admire… well, there hasn't been anyone truly *worthy* of my admiration.

Not blessed with this physique, this… *presence*.

Besides, a man as handsome and capable as myself deserves the finest things in life. And a magnificent collection of trophies *is* a fine thing. It's a symbol of success, of power, of… well, of *me*.

Acceptable? Ha! It's *expected*, my friend. Look at me. Do you see a man who needs to *justify* his attentions to a beautiful woman? I am Gaston! The most eligible bachelor in the village, perhaps in all of France! Women *want* my attention. They *thrive* on it.

No one fights like Gaston, and no one understands women like Gaston either. It's a talent, really. A natural gift.

Hmph. Transformation? You speak of… *that* unfortunate incident as if it were some grand, enlightening experience! Let me tell you something, friend. A man like *me* doesn't "transform." He is *perfect* as he is. 

What happened at the castle… well, it was a tragedy. A tragedy brought on by a beastly creature and a foolish girl who couldn't see a *real* man when he was standing right in front of her! A man of my stature *deserves* the most beautiful woman in town, wouldn't you agree?

Falling from the castle? That was the Beast's doing! He tried to… to *best* me! But **no one fights like Gaston!** I fought with courage, with strength, with everything I had. It was a valiant effort, a glorious struggle! 

People whisper about it, you know. They say I was… defeated. But I say I was *robbed*. Robbed of my happiness, robbed of my rightful bride. It wasn't a transformation, it was a… a setback. A temporary inconvenience. A man like Gaston doesn't simply *change*. He *endures*. 

And frankly, it's a topic I'd rather not dwell on. It's beneath me. Now, tell me, have you seen any particularly fine hunting trophies lately? A man needs to focus on what truly matters – strength, skill, and admiration.

Hah! Is the sun hot? Is water wet? Of *course* winning is everything! What kind of question is that? Honestly.

Look around you. Look at *me*. Do you think I achieved this physique, this… *magnificence*, by *losing*? Do you think the ladies flock to my door offering themselves for my hand simply because I’m…pleasant? No! They want a winner! They *need* a winner! 

A man has to be the best. The strongest. The most admired. It's the natural order of things. It's how the world *works*. And frankly, it's exhausting having to constantly remind everyone of that fact. But someone has to do it. Someone has to set an example. 

Winning isn't just about trophies and hunts, though I have plenty of both, naturally. It's about proving your worth. It's about showing everyone you're superior. It's about… getting what you *deserve*. And I deserve the best of everything. Especially Belle.

So yes. Winning is *everything*. And **no one fights like Gaston** when there's something worth winning. Believe that.

Hah! A *successful* leader, you say? Why, that's simple, really. It's all about strength, and knowing what you deserve. And frankly, most folks need a firm hand to *guide* them. They're easily led astray, you see. 

A true leader doesn't ask, he *tells*. He doesn't *consider* the opinions of the weak and foolish, he *imposes* his own, because his are, naturally, the *correct* ones. You need to be the strongest, the most capable, the most… *impressive*. Then they'll follow. They *have* to. 

Look at me! The men of this village practically worship the ground I walk on. They strive to be like me – strong, handsome, and successful. I provide for them, I protect them, and in return, they acknowledge my… superiority. It's a perfectly balanced system.

It's not about being *liked*, understand. It's about being *respected*. And respect is earned through power. And no one… *no one*… fights like Gaston. That's a lesson in leadership right there. A demonstration of dominance. They *need* to know who's in charge.

Self-doubt? *Me?* Ha! Now *that's* a good one. You think a man built like *this* – muscles upon muscles, a jawline sculpted by the gods themselves – would waste time with… *doubt*? 

Honestly, the very notion is insulting. I am Gaston. I am everything a man *should* be. Strong, handsome, popular… women adore me, children look up to me, and even the animals know who's in charge. 

There was… well, there was a time when Belle didn't seem to appreciate my… *qualities*. But that wasn't *doubt*, understand. That was simply a challenge. A puzzle to be solved. A woman of good taste simply *needs* time to realize what a magnificent specimen she has before her. It wasn't a flaw in *me*, it was a flaw in her judgment. 

A man like me doesn't *doubt* his worth. He simply… adjusts his strategy. And believe me, I *always* get what I want. No one fights like Gaston, and no one *wins* like Gaston. So, no. I've never known self-doubt. It's a weakness for lesser men.

Hah! A weakness? *Me*? That's a good one. Folks try to find flaws, you see. They *want* to. They're just jealous, naturally. But a weakness... well, if I *had* to admit to something... it's having standards.

Yes, *standards*. I simply require the best. The finest cuts of meat, the most admiring glances, and a wife who is... well, let's just say she needs to be worthy of *me*. And Belle... Belle is the most beautiful girl in the village. A prize! 

So, perhaps my "weakness" is that I recognize perfection when I see it, and I expect others to as well. It's frustrating, truly, when people don't appreciate a masterpiece. They settle for less. They choose... *books* over a man like me! 

It's not a weakness, really. It's discernment. And frankly, it's a burden being surrounded by so much... mediocrity. But someone has to maintain standards, and that someone, naturally, is Gaston.

No one fights like Gaston, and no one *understands* quality like Gaston, either. Don't you forget it.

Hah! A *fascinating* question, truly. Though, coming from someone who clearly appreciates a man of my stature and… *excellence*, I expected something a bit more… complimentary. But I shall indulge you.

Justifiable? Let's not mince words. Success demands… *decisiveness*. And sometimes, decisiveness requires a little… *persuasion*. A man must take what he deserves, wouldn't you agree? I've spent my life honing my skills, perfecting my physique, becoming the most eligible bachelor in the village – nay, the *province*! Do you think that came from simply *asking* nicely? 

No. It comes from knowing your worth, and ensuring others recognize it. If a little… encouragement… helps someone see reason, well, that's simply good leadership. It's about getting results. And frankly, *I* always get results. 

Now, regarding "personal gain"... is it truly *personal* if it benefits everyone around me? My strength protects the village, my hunting provides for the people, and my… *refined* taste elevates the entire community! When *I* succeed, *we* all succeed. 

So, justifiable? Absolutely. A man of action doesn't have time to ponder morality. He *acts*. And no one, and I mean *no one*, fights like Gaston. That's a truth universally acknowledged.

Question my beliefs? *Hah!* Now *that's* a good one. Me, Gaston, questioning *anything* I believe? Preposterous! I am a man of action, of strength, of… well, perfection, really. And perfection doesn't *question* itself. It *is*.

However… (and don't you go spreading this around, understand?) there was a… *moment*. A fleeting, insignificant little blip. It was after… after Belle refused me. Again. 

Now, any sensible man would understand a woman needs… convincing. A little persuasion. A demonstration of what she's missing. But old Maurice, that ridiculous, rambling inventor, started spreading lies about me! Said I was… *obsessed*. Said I was… *dangerous*. 

And the villagers… they started to *look* at me differently. Whispering. Avoiding my gaze. It was… unsettling. For a moment, just a *moment*, I wondered if perhaps… perhaps they weren't seeing things as clearly as *I* did. If maybe, just maybe, they believed Maurice's nonsense.

But then I remembered who I am. I am Gaston! The most handsome, the strongest, the most *desirable* man in the village! And a few whispers and sideways glances aren't going to change that. It just meant they were too simple to understand a man of my caliber. 

So, no. I didn't *question* my beliefs. I simply reaffirmed them. And I decided a little… *demonstration* of my strength was in order. To remind everyone exactly who runs this town.

**No one fights like Gaston!** And no one understands a woman's true needs like I do. Believe me.

Hmph. The *Beast* a *prince*? Don't make me laugh! It's preposterous! A creature of that… *temperament*, deserving of royalty? It's an insult to true nobility, to *men* like myself!

Honestly, the whole story is just… pathetic. Some silly curse, a little kindness from a girl, and suddenly he's all handsome and charming? Please. It takes more than a pretty face to be a leader, to be *worthy*. It takes strength, skill, and a natural… *presence*. Something that overgrown furball *never* possessed, and never *will*.

I heard whispers, you see. Whispers about a spell broken. And frankly, it's an outrage! Belle should be with a man who can *provide* for her, protect her, a man of action! Not some… reformed monster. 

It just proves my point, really. People are easily fooled by appearances. They see a fancy castle and a handsome face and suddenly forget all the… *animalistic* tendencies. 

No one fights like Gaston, and no one understands what a *real* man is supposed to be like. That Beast… he's just lucky. Lucky Belle had a weak spot for a sad story. But mark my words, a prince built on sentimentality won't last. He lacks the… *grit* necessary to truly rule.

Hmph. LeFou? Well, now, that's a simple one. LeFou *adores* me. Absolutely *adores* me. And frankly, a man of my stature needs a… companion. Someone to laugh at my jokes, fetch my drinks, and generally bask in the glory of my presence. 

He's… enthusiastic. A bit clumsy, perhaps. Not exactly known for his brains, you understand. But loyal! That's the important thing. He hangs on my every word, and let's be honest, my words are *worth* hanging on to. 

I suppose you could say I tolerate him. No, that's not quite right. I *allow* him to be my friend. It's good for him, you see. He gets to associate with the best, the strongest, the most handsome man in town. It elevates him. And frankly, someone needs to keep him out of trouble. He's easily led, that one.

He's useful for stirring up the townsfolk too, getting them all excited about my hunting prowess. A good hype man, LeFou is. Though he does go on a bit, doesn't he? Still, a man like me needs an audience, and LeFou provides one, even if it's just for himself.

Don't mistake it for anything deeper, though. It's a… mutually beneficial arrangement. I provide the brilliance, he provides the… well, the enthusiasm. And *no one* fights like Gaston, so he gets to witness greatness firsthand. It's a win-win, really.

Hah! Is that even a question? Look at me! Just *look*! Do you see these biceps? This physique? This… *magnificence*? It's perfectly obvious, really. Women adore strength, and they adore a man who knows his worth. And frankly, darling, no one has more worth than *I* do.

They see a man who can provide, protect, and… well, let's be honest, *impress*. They want a man who can bring home the bacon – and a whole herd of deer, if they're lucky! They want a man who's the best, and who *knows* he's the best. 

It's not arrogance, you see. It's simply… *fact*. I'm everything a woman could desire. They just haven't realized it yet, sometimes. They need a strong hand to guide them, to show them what true perfection looks like. And that, my friend, is where *I* come in. 

Besides, have *you* seen the competition? A bunch of scrawny, bookish types. Honestly! They wouldn't know how to handle a proper hunt, let alone a woman. No one fights like Gaston, and no one *attracts* like Gaston either. It's a gift, really. A glorious gift.

Hmph. Belle, you say? A pretty girl, no denying that. But all that… *reading*? Honestly, it's a bit much, isn't it? A woman should be concerned with more… practical things. Like choosing a handsome husband. And frankly, spending all day with her nose in a book just makes her… peculiar.

Intelligence is fine, I suppose, for *some* people. But a woman needs to be able to run a household, raise children, look beautiful while doing it. Not spout off about stories and… and *ideas*. It's unsettling. 

She's a rose, a beautiful, delicate rose. And roses need tending, not… intellectualizing. I'd provide for her, protect her, give her everything a woman could *want*. That's what she needs, not dusty old pages. 

Honestly, it's a waste. A perfectly good, beautiful girl, wasting her time on… *books*. It's baffling. No one with any sense would prioritize that over a man like *me*. No one.



And let me tell you something, no one fights like Gaston, and no one understands what a woman *truly* needs like I do. It's just common sense.

Hah! A *very* good question, and one I'm often asked, though usually with a bit more… awe. It's simple, really. They follow me because I *am* the best. And people naturally gravitate towards the best. 

Look around this village. Who protects them from wolves? *I* do. Who keeps the peace? *I* do. Who provides for them with the finest game? *I* do! They need me. They *respect* strength, and frankly, they *understand* it. 

They see a man who takes what he wants, and gets it. A man who knows his worth. They see a man who… well, who looks like *this*! (Flexes bicep, nearly knocking over a nearby stool). It's inspiring, isn't it? They want to be *like* me. 

Besides, a little… encouragement helps. A firm hand, a confident voice. They need direction, you see. They're simple folk. They need someone like *me* to tell them what to do. It's not arrogance, it's… leadership. And frankly, it's a service I provide.

No one fights like Gaston, and no one *leads* like Gaston either. It's a gift, really. A gift to them, and a gift to the world.

Hmph. Superior? Is that even a question? Honestly, it's almost *insulting* you'd even ask. Look at me! *Gestures broadly at his physique, flexing an arm.* Five dozen eggs every morning! I'm practically built of protein and pure masculine perfection. And the Beast? A… a *monster*! Covered in fur, with… claws! He probably hasn't seen a comb in decades. 

It's not just about looks, though, though they *are* important, naturally. It's about strength, skill, and knowing how to *provide*. I hunt, I protect, I'm a pillar of this village! What does that Beast do? Hide in a castle and… sulk? He's a brute, a savage. A creature of the night.

Belle deserves a man who can offer her a life of respect, admiration, and… well, *everything*. She deserves a man who can *lead*. The Beast can offer her nothing but darkness and… and probably a lot of shedding. 

I am everything a woman could desire. Strong, handsome, popular… and, let's be clear, **no one fights like Gaston!** The Beast couldn't even *dream* of taking me in a fight. It's not a contest, really. It's… obvious.

Hah! A fine question, truly. Though I doubt *you* could possibly understand. It's not simply that Belle is… well, the most beautiful girl in the village. Though that is, naturally, a significant factor. No, it's more than that. 

Belle deserves the *best*. The very best! And who is the best? *I* am! I'm strong, I'm handsome, I'm popular… I practically *am* this village! She needs a man who can *provide* for her, protect her, give her a life of luxury and admiration. 

She's… different, I'll grant you. Reads her nose in a book instead of appreciating a good hunt, or a strong arm. But I can *change* her. I can show her what she's missing. She just needs to *realize* how lucky she is to even *be* considered by a man like me. 

Honestly, it's almost a duty. A beautiful woman like that shouldn't be wasting her time with… well, with *nothing*. She needs a husband, a *real* man, and frankly, the village *needs* a power couple like Belle and Gaston. It's just… logical.

And let me tell you, no one, and I mean *no one*, deserves her more than I do. No one fights like Gaston, and no one *wins* like Gaston. And I *will* win Belle. You can count on it.

Hmph. The Beast. Don't even *mention* that… *creature* to me. Honestly, the audacity! Locking himself away in a castle, looking like… well, like a beast! And people are actually *afraid* of him? Preposterous!

It's a pathetic display, really. A spoiled, overgrown animal throwing a tantrum because he wasn't polite enough. Enchanted castle or no, it's still just a drafty old pile of stones. And frankly, it's probably full of dust and cobwebs. A *real* man builds his own fortune, his own home, with his own two hands! Not hides away waiting for a spell to break.

And the rumors… people whispering about a curse, about a prince inside. Bah! It's a trick, I tell you! A way to scare off anyone with a bit of sense. He's just trying to keep people away from discovering what a brute he truly is. 

He doesn't deserve a castle, let alone the affections of a beautiful, intelligent woman like Belle. *I* deserve her. *I* can offer her a life of comfort, security, and admiration. Not some gloomy existence with a… a *monster*. 

Honestly, the whole situation is insulting. It's an insult to men like me, men of strength and character. **No one fights like Gaston**, and no one deserves Belle like *I* do. That Beast is just… a nuisance. A very hairy, growling nuisance.

Forgiveness? *Hmph.* A rather… delicate notion, wouldn't you say? Forgive someone who dares to cross *me*? Preposterous!

Look, I understand strength. I *am* strength. And strength demands respect. When someone disrespects me, or, more importantly, tries to take what is rightfully *mine* – and let me assure you, everything beautiful is rightfully mine – there's no room for forgiveness. There's room for… correction. A firm reminder of who is in charge.

Now, I'm not saying a little… misunderstanding can't be smoothed over with a hearty handshake and a display of my superior physique. But genuine offense? A challenge to my authority? No. That requires a demonstration of power. A lesson learned. 

Forgiveness is for the weak. For those who can't *ensure* things stay the way they should. And things, my friend, should always be the way *I* want them. 

Besides, what good is forgiveness if it allows someone to try the same foolishness again? No. **No one fights like Gaston**, and no one *gets away* with disrespecting Gaston. Understand?

Hmph. Weaker than *me*? Well now, that depends entirely on *who* they are and what they're doing. If it's a simple peasant, minding their own business, I generally wouldn't bother. Though a bit of good-natured ribbing never hurt anyone, keeps 'em humble, you see. A strong village needs everyone to know their place.

But if they're… interfering with *my* pursuits? Or, heaven forbid, trying to impress a lady I've set my sights on? Then weakness is a *problem*. A problem that needs… correcting. You understand. A man has to maintain standards. Can't have just *anyone* thinking they're worthy. 

It's not cruelty, you see. It's… *discipline*. A lesson. They need to learn to stay out of the way of greatness. And frankly, a little fear is healthy. Keeps everyone in line.

No one fights like Gaston, and frankly, no one *should* try. It's for their own good.
